title: Establish Survival Priorities Based on Environment
brief: Create an ordered priority list of survival needs that adapts to your specific environment and conditions.
steps: List core survival needs: food, water, shelter, fire, first aid, and signals.
Assess your immediate environment and threats (cold, heat, injury, enemy).
Reorder priorities based on most immediate life threats - first aid always tops the list if injured.
For cold environments: prioritize fire for warmth, then shelter, then food procurement, then signals.
For hot environments: prioritize water and shade, then shelter, then food, then signals.
Continuously reassess and adjust priorities as conditions and environment change.
Focus resources and energy on top 2-3 priorities before addressing lower-priority needs.
warnings: First aid must be top priority regardless of climate if you are injured.
Failing to adapt priorities to changing conditions can be fatal.
Don't spread effort too thin across all needs simultaneously.
